revised_title: Material Content of the Universe: A Review of the 1986 Meeting Summary
tldr: The article discusses the current understanding of the material content of the Universe, focusing on the large-scale distribution of mass, composition, and cosmic evolution. It explores the possibility of exotic matter, dark matter, and the Einstein-de Sitter cosmological model. The authors also discuss the formation of galaxies, the role of cosmic strings, and the prospects for laboratory detection of exotic matter.
